title: Aston Martin reveals what it calls 'the greatest car lineup in a Bond movie, ever'
text:
CLOSE James Bond’s favorite ride used in the movies Goldfinger and Thunderball was recently sold for a price that would even leave the super spy shaken, but not stirred. Buzz60

Six months before the debut of the next James Bond film, the automaker responsible for many of the franchise's legendary sports cars revealed which vehicles received co-starring roles in the movie.

Aston Martin tweeted Wednesday that cars from the brand's "past, present and future" will make an appearance in the 25th James Bond installment, titled "No Time to Die."

The company's classic DB5 and V8 Vantage, along with the new DBS Superleggera and Valhalla, will be spotlighted in the movie. "There is something for every Bond fan," Aston Martin said.

Past, present and future.



To mark the 25th Bond film, #NoTimeToDie, four of our cars will be featured in the film.



From the classic DB5 and V8 Vantage, to the new DBS Superleggera and Aston Martin Valhalla, there is something for every Bond fan.#JamesBondDay@007pic.twitter.com/cmKvswriHo — Aston Martin (@astonmartin) October 5, 2019

Representing Aston Martin's past is the DB5.

One of three surviving DB5s went up for auction over the summer and sold for $6.3 million. The car is perhaps best known for its appearance alongside Sean Connery in “Goldfinger,” the third movie in the James Bond series.

Also from the past is the company's 1977 V8 Vantage, which has a top speed of about 170 mph and accelerates from 0-60 mph in 5.2 seconds, according to Aston Martin.

The British marque’s new $300,000 DBS Superleggera will signify the brand's present-day offerings, making its cinematic debut. The supercar houses a 5.2-liter twin-turbo V12 which produces 715-horsepower and 663 foot-pounds of torque.

The futuristic Valhalla built with "space-age" materials is also set to appear in this film. The company said it made only 500 Vahallas.

Daniel Craig will play James Bond in the movie.
